attributes.action: Bring in Legislation to stop Supermarkets exploiting the 28 day rule
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the Department of Trade and Industry's code of practice on
price indications, it says that shops can only advertise a
product as being discounted if it has been priced at the higher rate for 28 days. However.......with fruit and veg, the publicised discount only relates to the
last advertised price.

This means supermarkets can hike the price up of Fruit and Veg
one week and decrease it the next. They can then advertise the
product at being reduced in price. 

Some supermarkets even
advertise that the price has been decreased by upto 50% (Or more) but in
fact if you take the average price over the last 28 days it
hasn't been reduced at all.I believe this is very misleading to
shoppers!!!

Legislation should be brought in to close this loophole.
